project_description: A simple Flutter app with two screens: a login screen and a home screen, using the Cubit pattern for state management.
architecture_overview: The project follows a layered architecture with a clear separation between UI, state management, and data models. Cubits are used for state management, and each screen has its own Cubit.

files.description: The entry point of the Flutter application. Provides the necessary Cubits using BlocProvider.

files.description: Manages the state for the login screen.

methods.description: Handles user login with email and password.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
User -> LoginScreen: Open App
LoginScreen -> LoginCubit: Submit Login
LoginCubit -> HomeScreen: Navigate on Success
User -> HomeScreen: Click Logout
HomeScreen -> HomeCubit: Logout
HomeCubit -> LoginScreen: Navigate to Login
@enduml
state_management_flow: State is managed using Cubits. The LoginCubit handles login state changes, and the HomeCubit handles logout state changes. The state flows from the Cubit to the UI components via BlocProvider and BlocBuilder.
navigation_flow: The app starts with the LoginScreen. Upon successful login, the user is navigated to the HomeScreen. From the HomeScreen, the user can log out, which navigates back to the LoginScreen.
